intro: Mollinedia foreroi, commonly known as the Forero's mallow, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Mollinedia foreroi is often found in moist, shaded environments such as cloud forests.
